markdown:
<title level="1" right="Rules">[Forest Geomancy](/Rules.aspx?ID=1525)</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Secrets of Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=96) pg. 211 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

<row gap="medium">
<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">
Forest are defined by the thick growth of plants, a canopy of green home to creatures across every stratum from the forest floor to the treetops. All forests, from those of humid ferns to frozen conifers, share growth and creation. This generative power thrives in a geomancer, coming to life in spells that spring vines and thorns or call forth ancient creatures tied to the land.
</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>
name: Forest Geomancy

</additional-info>
text: Forest Geomancy Source Secrets of Magic pg. 211 1.1 Forest are defined by the thick growth of plants, a canopy of green home to creatures across every stratum from the forest floor to the treetops. All forests, from those of humid ferns to frozen conifers, share growth and creation. This generative power thrives in a geomancer, coming to life in spells that spring vines and thorns or call forth ancient creatures tied to the land.
